title.narrative: Program to Improve Food Security by Strengthening the Resilience of Vulnerable Households and their Economic Integration in Transition

description.narrative: The deterioration of security conditions in Central African Republic (CAR), including population displacement and banditry, has substantially affected the food security throughout the country. Moreover, corruption and difficulties with transport have constrained the agricultural sector in the country. The global increase of food prices in combination with insecurity and economic stagnation has decreased the buying power of households, negatively impacting the ability of vulnerable households to access sufficient nourishment. This dynamic is particularly evident in Nana Mambere Prefecture, where more than 73% of household expenditures are dedicated to food purchases, resulting in a global acute malnutrition (GAM) rate of 35.6%, well above emergency thresholds. To address these challenges, Mercy Corps is working to address the fundamental contributors to food insecurity using an integrated approach increasing the availability and access of food while supporting good dietary quality. The program has three main focuses: 1) improve the nutritional status of households by increasing knowledge of good food and hygiene practices; 2) improve the availability and quality of staple food goods in the markets, and 3) improve agricultural productivity and incomes through reliable access to agricultural inputs and markets.
